html: 12.19.18  8:17 pm   Have you ever considered not making videos to go along with your songs? If you start putting out a short non-music video every other week, we'll get a full song and a full video every two weeks, and you might have more free time.
12.19.18  8:08 pm   How many is life
12.19.18  8:08 pm   Do you feel like you constantly have to one up your past self when it comes to long projects?

12.19.18  2:59 pm   We had a substitute in class today and he let us put down songs on a list and he would play them on a speaker. I put down "La de da de da de da de day oh." The substitute wouldn't play it because it "wasn't popular enough." Then all the kids started to laugh. Am I a loser?
12.19.18  11:55 am   do you prefer dark chocolate or milk chocolate
12.19.18  11:51 am   are you going to finish your music video for "Just Did a Bad Thing"
12.19.18  11:34 am   what's your favorite slang word or slang phrase?
12.19.18  11:09 am   Calculus is like poetry?
12.19.18  10:06 am   can you please explain who's the bird who delivered the letter to Steve on top of the mountain ? I mean the species of the bird :)
12.19.18  9:32 am   do you have a motivation behind your videos?

12.19.18  9:31 am   I have a habit of listening back to my works a lot, but a lot of guys I admire say that they don't listen to what they have created. Am I preventing myself from moving forward at a speed I am capable of? How can I break this habit?

12.19.18  9:17 am   how about a "3-week schedule"? 2 weeks for a song 1 week for an anything video and after being done with the anything video use the remaining time of the week for a big project. I think it's an optimized schedule cause you can't break it since you have the original 2 weeks for the song and potentially have 1 week for the anything vid but if it takes less time you can make progress on another project.
12.19.18  8:43 am   should I breathe?
12.19.18  8:30 am   Would you say your songs and videos are a giant middle finger to what society thinks "good art" actually is?
12.19.18  6:26 am   what is your octave range
12.19.18  6:01 am   Are you going to ever update the "Notebook" thing?
12.19.18  5:43 am   How do you right lyrics? Im kind of in a writing block as of now.

12.19.18  3:08 am   I'm a young musician who hasn't yet figured out how to understand most things without learning them academically, and I am frustrated because I cannot currently access an education that goes deeper than basic classical music theory.  If you wouldn't mind sharing, could you explain some of the techniques you use for musical development in your songs?  Like, what are ways you can make the different parts of the songs sound different from each other?

12.19.18  2:52 am   When you want to learn things, how do you do it?  We have the internet, but it's incredibly unorganized.  

     How do you find information?

12.19.18  2:13 am    Will public resistance prevent the introduction
of technological control of human behavior?
12.19.18  1:53 am   it's 1:53 AM, what do I do?
12.19.18  1:44 am   what's the difference between C6 and Am7?
12.19.18  12:59 am   Do you use this comment section as any sort of inspiration?

12.19.18  12:47 am   i'm trying to music better by figuring out chords to your songs and improving on them. just saying thanks.

in the chorus of 'and the day goes on', why does this magic work: Bm/D F#/C# Ddim D#min Bm/D F#/C# ...?  I never seen a dim chord fit in like that.. and it sounds so feel-good.

12.19.18  12:43 am   Is it ok for me to listen to music and not care about the theory behind it?

      I totally get that music theory is descriptive not prescriptive, and all that jazz, and I'd never stop anyone from enjoying music in that way, but I just like to listen to music for the immediate emotional reaction of it. Thoughts?

      Also, as a music maker, how does it make you feel when people break down your work?

      do you prefer people to experience it one way or another?

12.19.18  12:36 am   So... Will "just did a bad thing" have a music video?

     Or that's the thing that got fucked and it'll be a single without video?
12.19.18  12:14 am   Do u know exactly what you're doing?

12.18.18  9:33 pm   Loved just did a bad thing! Is it a meta track about releasing song without video?

      Do you consider changing the rules or how you play the game doing something bad?

12.18.18  9:05 pm   so you released your song on tuesday, rather than friday as you initially planned. (I don't mind, I understand the importance of the tuesday release)

My question: did you use the extra time to finish up the song,

      or to get ahead in the next video?

      Are you hoping to get back on schedule?

      If so, are you aiming for an even crazier schedule?

12.18.18  8:54 pm   i'm asking this question at 8:53 pm on tuesday, which you can see already but it's important to mention for context, if you don't finish the "bad thing" video by late-night tuesday, and you end up having to finish it a different day, will you finish it and release it on wednesday, or wait to release the video until the next tuesday?

12.18.18  8:52 pm   12.17.18  1:26 pm but there's some sort of new larger scale project you'll be gradually chipping away at alongside the songs and other stuff, right?

      or did you abandon that?
